etymologies: late 16th century: from French, probably from Italian tavolatura, from tavolare ‘set to music’

definitions: a form of musical notation indicating fingering rather than the pitch of notes, written on lines corresponding to, for example, the strings of a guitar or the holes on a flute

examples.text: some of them didn't read music or tablature

shortDefinitions: form of musical notation indicating fingering rather than pitch of notes
